properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing heavy rain and large hail. Strong wind gusts are also possible. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-11T08:44:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-10T21:35:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2863039106.2019

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hot and humid conditions are expected today. Daytime high temperatures will be near thirty degrees with humidex values in the mid thirties. A low pressure system is expected to move through the area on Thursday bringing cooler temperatures with it. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-11T01:04:12-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-10T09:05:12-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0398558257.2019
Area: Fraserdale - Pledger Lake, Kapuskasing - Hearst - Smooth Rock Falls
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A hot and humid air mass will remain over the area into Thursday. Temperatures in the low thirties are expected this afternoon, with humidex values in the upper thirties. Minimum temperatures tonight will be near 20 degrees Celsius, providing little relief from the heat. Temperatures on Thursday afternoon will once again reach into the low thirties. A slightly cooler and less humid air mass will arrive in the wake of a cold front Thursday evening providing relief from the heat into Friday. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-11T11:00:34-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-10T19:01:34-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2093650081.2019

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Heavy rain continues today. A large area of rain continues to soak the region today. Total rainfall amounts from this event of 50 to 75 mm are expected in many areas. A few locally higher rainfall amounts of 75 to 100 mm are possible in areas that receive a thunderstorm or two. Rain is expected to move out of the region this evening in the wake of a low pressure system moving from Northwestern Ontario to James Bay by this evening. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-11T01:20:48-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-10T09:21:48-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4126917560.2019

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Locally heavy rainfall continues this evening. Rain and isolated thunderstorms are expected to continue early this evening as a low pressure system moves across Northwestern Ontario. Rainfall amounts are forecast to be highly variable across the region, with many areas receiving 20 to 40 mm, and local 50 mm possible in areas that receive a thunderstorm. The rain will move out of the area by this evening as the low pressure system moves away to James Bay. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-11T04:49:45-00:00

properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert: Overland Flow Flood Alert Cancelled
properties.Summary:
Description: Floodwaters within Yellowhead County are receding, but there are areas that are still flooded, and the public must be cautious when in or near these areas. Possible well water contamination and sewer issues from the flooding is still a concern, and the public should follow the County Facebook page for more information.### Go to www.facebook.com/yellowheadcounty/ for more Yellowhead County information.
Expires: 2019-07-17T14:18:09-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Alberta Emergency Management Agency on behalf of Yellowhead County, 2019-07-10T14:16:30-06:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-5914
Area: Yellowhead County
properties.Author: Alberta Emergency Management Agency on behalf of Yellowhead County

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 2:28m PDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. The thunderstorm is located 20 km southwest of Hixon and is moving northeast at 20 km/h. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca.
Expires: 2019-07-11T00:26:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-10T21:31:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0759607262.2019
Area: Prince George
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: High levels of air pollution due to smoke from forest fires will continue tonight for a large part of Northern Ontario. Smoke plumes are moving over the region from several forest fires located in the Sandy Lake - Pikangikum region. There are also additional smaller fires in Northeastern Ontario. Air quality may deteriorate if the smoke descends to ground level. If you or those in your care are exposed to wildfire smoke, consider taking extra precautions to reduce your exposure. Wildfire smoke is a constantly-changing mixture of particles and gasses which includes many chemicals that can harm your health. For more details, please consult www.canada.ca/en/environment-climate-change/services/air-quality-health-index/wildfire-smoke.html. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-07-11T11:35:25-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the Province of Ontario, 2019-07-10T19:36:25-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3877305001.2019

properties.Summary:

The thunderstorm is located just northeast of Eagle Creek and is moving northeastward at 25 km/h. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca.

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Elevated pollution levels are expected or occurring. AIR QUALITY ADVISORY FOR YUKON The office of the Yukon Chief Medical Officer of Health has issued an Air Quality Advisory for all Yukon communities due to high or increasing concentrations of wildfire smoke. Wildfires in Alaska and central Yukon are causing increased concentrations of smoke throughout the territory. Local conditions may also affect the concentration of smoke in each community. Please note that there is no immediate wildfire threat to any Yukon communities. Smoke can impact your health if it lingers in your community. Please observe the following recommendations: - You may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, eye or throat irritation, or shortness of breath. If you are experiencing symptoms, limit outdoor activity and/or strenuous physical activity; if breathing becomes difficult or uncomfortable, stop or reduce the activity. - Make sure you identify and support those who are at increased risk from wildfire smoke. These include small children, elders, pregnant women, and those with lung or heart disease. - If you have a health condition that could worsen with the smoke (asthma, chronic lung disease or COPD, or heart disease) check in with your health care provider to make sure that you have a plan for managing your condition. Make sure your medications and supplies are available and up-to-date. - Reduce exposure to smoky air by staying indoors and turning on an air cleaner with a HEPA filter, if you have one. Keep indoor air as clean as possible by avoiding smoking or burning other materials. - If your symptoms worsen or you are concerned about your health or the health of a friend/family member, contact the health line at 811, contact your health care provider, or go to your Community Health Centre or hospital emergency department. - For advice about keeping your home air clean and cool visit www.hss.gov.yk.ca/wildfiresmoke.php - To view an hourly forecast of smoke conditions in Yukon, visit www.firesmoke.ca/forecasts/current ### Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-07-11T03:48:19-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the Government of Yukon, 2019-07-10T11:49:19-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2424092583.2019
Area: Dawson, Mayo, Beaver Creek, Pelly - Carmacks, Kluane Lake, Haines Junction, Whitehorse, Teslin Y.T., Cassiar Mountains Y.T., Watson Lake Y.T., Faro - Ross River, Dempster, Old Crow
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the Government of Yukon

properties.Title: Smog Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: High concentrations of fine particulates are expected and will result in poor air quality. Smoke plumes from several wildfires in Northwestern Ontario are moving over Southwestern Quebec. The air quality could deteriorate at ground level. The high concentrations particles should persist until Wednesday afternoon. ### Smog especially affects asthmatic children and people with respiratory ailments or heart disease. It is therefore recommended that these individuals avoid intense physical activity outdoors until the smog warning is lifted. Additional information: To learn more about the Info-Smog program, go to Environment Canada‚Äôs website at www.canada.ca/info-smog-program. For air quality indexes in Quebec, visit the website of the Minist√®re de l'Environnement et de la Lutte contre les changements climatiques at www.iqa.environnement.gouv.qc.ca/contenu/index_en.asp. To learn more about the effects of smog on your health in Qu√©bec, visit the Minist√®re de la Sant√© et des Services sociaux‚Äôs website at www.quebec.ca/en/health. You can also visit the Direction r√©gionale de sant√© publique du CIUSSS du Centre-Sud-de-l‚Äô√éle-de-Montr√©al at www.santemontreal.qc.ca/en/public. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing damaging wind gusts, damaging hail and heavy rain. Severe thunderstorms with hail as large as golf balls and strong winds exceeding 100 km/h are possible late this afternoon. These severe thunderstorms are likely to persist into the late evening hours. ### Very large hail can damage property, break windows, dent vehicles and cause serious injury. Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-11T09:14:20-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-10T21:46:20-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0787593697.2019

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A hot and humid air mass will remain over the area into Thursday. Temperatures in the low thirties area expected early this evening, with humidex values in the upper thirties. Minimum temperatures tonight will be in the low twenties, providing little relief from the heat. Temperatures on Thursday afternoon will reach the low thirties. A slightly cooler and less humid air mass will arrive in the wake of a cold front Thursday evening providing relief from the heat into Friday. However, hot and humid conditions may return once again on the weekend or early next week. ### Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-11T11:01:51-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-10T19:02:51-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0544337259.2019

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 40 knots. Thunderstorms are developing over Michigan and are expected to track over northern Lake Huron and North Channel this evening. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2019-07-11T04:39:28-00:00

Area: Northern Lake Huron
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Heavy rain continues this evening. A large area of rain continues to soak the region this evening. Total rainfall amounts from this event of 50 to 75 mm are expected in many areas. A few locally higher rainfall amounts in excess of 100 mm are also possible. Rain is expected to move out of the region tonight in the wake of a low pressure system moving from Northwestern Ontario to James Bay overnight. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-11T12:14:15-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-10T20:18:15-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2314277717.2019

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts and large hail. Thunderstorms are expected to develop late this afternoon or this evening in west-central Saskatchewan. Some of these thunderstorms may become severe with hail to the size of loonies and wind gusts to 100 km/h. Thunderstorms will weaken later this evening. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-11T06:48:39-00:00

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing damaging wind gusts, damaging hail and heavy rain. Severe thunderstorms with hail as large as golf balls and strong winds exceeding 100 km/h are possible late this afternoon. These severe thunderstorms are likely to persist into the late evening hours. ### Very large hail can damage property, break windows, dent vehicles and cause serious injury. Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-11T09:14:20-00:00
